definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: My friends and I manned the booth at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友在照應展銷會上的這個攤點。

sentences.english: It is prohibited to set up chop and seal engraving stalls outside the places checked and ratified by the License.
sentences.chinese: 禁止在《許可證》覈定的地點以外設立印章刻制攤點。

sentences.english: We had our own Chinese medicine shops, dentists and market stalls.
sentences.chinese: 我們有我們自己的中藥店，牙醫和街邊攤點。

sentences.english: Other families are selling heifers, chicks and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 還有的家庭攤點出售牝牛，家禽和小兔等。

sentences.english: The restaurant and catering industry employs literally millions of people throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地飯店和飲食攤點實際上都僱用了千百萬人。

sentences.english: Vendors' stands spread unchecked, causing traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 亂設攤點氾濫成災，造成交通堵塞。
